page.title: 07History of Niton Lighthouses
page.content: In 1314 the first lighthouse was built on St.Catherine's Hill,soon after the wreck of a ship called 'The Mary of Bayonne' which was carrying a cargo of wine from a monastery in France.Walter de Godeton,who owned the land where the wreck occurred,claimed the wine for himself.Some monks complained to the Pope about it and he gave Walter the task of building a lighthouse and chapel as a punishment.We now call it 'The Pepperpot'.Unfortunately it only showed up on clear nights and was frequently covered in mist .Then one night in 1836 a ship called 'The Clarendon'was wrecked in Chale Bay. Most of her company were drowned. People were so shocked,that they decided something had to be done; they built a new lighthouse at St. Catherine's Point.The light first shone in 1840.
